gw.plugin.financials.impl

Class AggregateLimitTransactionPluginImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.plugin.financials.impl.AggregateLimitTransactionPluginImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public class AggregateLimitTransactionPluginImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin
    Default implementation of IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin that implements transaction applicability based on the aggregatelimitused-config.xml configuration file. Calls the standard aggregate limit method "configurationAppliesTo" to see if a limit applies to a transaction. Returns just Transaction from typesWhichAffectApplicability(). Returns a claim from claimWithChangedTransactionApplicability(KeyableBean) if the transaction's cost type or category has changed.

    Customers can use this plugin implementation directly or they can also create an instance of this plugin implementation and use it as a helper in their own plugin implementation, in order to add in the normal handling of aggregatelimitused-config.xml

    • Method Detail

      • aggregateLimitApplies

        public boolean aggregateLimitApplies(AggregateLimit limit,
                                     Transaction transaction)
        Does the given aggregate limit apply to the given transaction? This check should rely only on values stored in entities. For example it shouldn't return different values depending on the age of the transaction, as ClaimCenter would have no way of detecting when the transaction age should trigger a change.

        If this check depends on entities other than Transaction then the typesWhichAffectApplicability() method should be overridden as well, to return those entity types.

        This out of box implementation calls the aggregate limit's configurationAppliesTo(transaction) method, which consults the aggregate limit configuration in aggregatelimitused-config.xml to see whether the transaction applies to the limit. Most customer implementations will want to call this method in addition to their own custom logic, but it is not a requirement; a customer could choose to ignore the configuration in some situations.

        Specified by:
        aggregateLimitApplies in interface IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin
        Parameters:
        limit - a non null aggregate limit
        transaction - a non null transaction
        Returns:
        true if the limit should apply, false otherwise

      • typesWhichAffectApplicability

        public java.util.Set<IEntityType> typesWhichAffectApplicability()
        The set of types which can affect whether a limit should apply to a transaction. This set should usually include Transaction unless the system has been configured so that changes to the transaction itself do not affect applicability.

        This out of box implementation returns a set containing just Transaction

        Specified by:
        typesWhichAffectApplicability in interface IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin
        Returns:
        a non null, but possibly empty, set

      • claimWithChangedTransactionApplicability

        public Claim claimWithChangedTransactionApplicability(KeyableBean modifiedEntity)
        Examines the given modified entity and determines if it has changed in a way that may change the applicability of a limit to one or more transactions. If so, return the claim to which the transaction(s) belong. ClaimCenter will then recalculate the aggregate limit values associated with this claim.

        This method will only be called for a modified entity whose type is one of the types specified b typesWhichAffectApplicability(). The implementation of the method will have to check the type of the entity and cast it to do any type specific checks.

        The modified entity may be inserted (New/isNew()), updated (Changed/isChanged()) or removed (Retired, for retireable entities).

        This method should not return a claim if the only thing that has changed is an out of box transaction or aggregate limit field that always causes aggregate limit recalculation (such as a transaction's amount, or a coverage line's coverage type); ClaimCenter already checks these fields. The intent is to let ClaimCenter know about changes that the out of box logic would not normally consider relevant, such as changes to extension fields or custom entities.

        This out of box implementation checks if any transaction fields relevant to the aggregate limit configuration file (aggregatelimitused-config.xml) have changed.

        Specified by:
        claimWithChangedTransactionApplicability in interface IAggregateLimitTransactionPlugin
        Parameters:
        modifiedEntity - a non null modified entity, guaranteed to be an entity whose type is in the set returned by typesWhichAffectApplicability().
        Returns:
        if the change to this entity could change the applicability of one or more transactions to some limit, then return the claim that owns the affected transaction(s). Otherwise return null.
